SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Vascular malformation signaling pathways are the least understood out of all cutaneous endothelial lesions
The overexpression of Akt is known to cause vascular malformations in endothelial cells of mice
Since there are no Akt inhibitors approved for clinical use, we examined phosphorylated S6 expression, a downstream target of Akt
Phosphorylated S6 indicates potential sensitivity to rapamycin
METHODS AND RESULTS: Immunohistochemistry for phospho-s6k against phospho-S6 ribosomal protein was performed on specimens of vascular malformations taken from Sturge- Weber patients
Of the specimens, 70.8% were immunopositive for phospho-s6k
CONCLUSION: Endothelial expression of Akt is responsible for tumor responsiveness to rapamycin
We demonstrate that expression of phosphorylated S6 is elevated in specimens
Our findings provide a rationale for clinical trials of rapamycin on Sturge-Weber or Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber patients
